Figure : Algorithm for the management of an initial episode of genital herpes during pregnancy (source RPC CNGOF 2017)

Figure : Algorithm for the management of a herpetic recurrence during pregnancy (source RPC CNGOF 2017)
[[File:Algorithm for the management of a herpetic recurrence during pregnancy (source RPC CNGOF 2017).png|vignette|Algorithm for the management of a herpetic recurrence during pregnancy (source RPC CNGOF 2017)]]
3 messages:

1/ in case of primary infection: maternal treatment (aciclovir 1g in 5 doses or valaciclovir 2g in 2 doses for 5 to 10 days) and caesarean section if infection within 6 weeks before start of labour except RPM > 4h.

2/ recurrence: no sampling, vaginal route possible if RPM >4h

3/ prevention in case of recurrence with valaciclovir 1g in 2 doses from 36 SA until birth

question.question: What is the recommended management for a pregnant woman experiencing a primary infection of genital herpes within 6 weeks before the start of labor?
question.option_a: Administer aciclovir 1g in 5 doses for 5 to 10 days and perform a caesarean section if the rupture of membranes (ROM) is less than 4 hours.
question.option_b: Administer valaciclovir 2g in 2 doses for 5 to 10 days and allow vaginal delivery if the rupture of membranes (ROM) is more than 4 hours.
question.option_c: Administer aciclovir 1g in 5 doses for 5 to 10 days and allow vaginal delivery regardless of the rupture of membranes (ROM).
question.option_d: Administer valaciclovir 2g in 2 doses for 5 to 10 days and perform a caesarean section if the rupture of membranes (ROM) is less than 4 hours.
